Two women who falsely accused a woman of trying to kill her own baby have been locked up - after their victim died of an overdose. 
Their victim, Jayne Pearce, 23, from Oldham, was wrongly jailed and charged with attempted murder after friends falsely claimed she had tried to smother the three-month-old child . 
The single mum later went on to die of an overdose after being told she would have to testify in court against her accusers. Read More Policeman tells of childhood abuse at hands of paedophile - as he sees his attacker finally jailed 
Her tormentors, Leonie Hampson-Ogden, 23, and Shauna Stanway, 21, have now been jailed for perverting the course of justice. Jayne Pearce was locked up for three months after being falsely accused of trying to kill her own baby 
Miss Pearce’s devastated relatives, welcoming the sentence, said the pair would ‘now face the consequence of their lies’. 
The actions of Hampson-Ogden and Stanway resulted in Miss Pearce being wrongly locked up for three months after they claimed she had tried to kill the child - and then confessed on Facebook. Read More 
She was eventually cleared of wrongdoing, but the young mum was badly affected by her spell in jail and sought counselling in a bid to ‘block out the memories’. Leonie Hampson-Ogden leaving Manchester Minshull Street Crown Court 
Tragedy struck when police told her she would be reliving her ordeal in the witness box after officers charged the two women with perverting the course of justice. Read More Jail for the evil pimp and his aunt, who forced young mums into Manchester's red light district - telling one terrified victim 'work, you dog' 
The warehouse worker - who had a four-year-old son - posted a message on Facebook saying: “Just when I think everything is all over with, it all gets dragged back up. Oh well, justice has to be done. At least that puts my name in the clear and people can stop with their lies.” Shauna Stanway 
Tragically, just two days before she was due to give evidence, Miss Pearce was found dead in her flat in Royton after ingesting a fatal combination of vodka, cocaine and the anti-depressant drug fluoxetine, an inquest into her death revealed. 
It then emerged that Hampson-Ogden and Stanway were intending to plead guilty and Miss Pearce would not have to give evidence after all.
